creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
markings: red artist's seal: 春 {Shun} | publisher seal: 渡辺工 {Watanabe kō} (work of Watanabe); red publisher's seal: 渡辺工 {Watanabe kō} (work by Watanabe)
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper with mica and embossing
portfolio: Creative Prints: Collected Portraits by Shunsen (Sōsaku hanga: Shunsen nigao-e shū 創作版画　春仙似顔画集)
text: Thirty-second design of a set of 36. Actor Bandō Jūzaburō III (1886-1954) as the sumo wrestler Mizuhiki Seigorō who will change his name to Kuryūzan Namiemon 九龍山浪右衛門. The scene should be Shinagawa Shimazakirō 品川島崎楼 of the play The Spirit of Megumi, a Match in Harmony (Kami no megumi wagō no torikumi 神明恵和合取組), commonly called Megumi no kenka or The Megumi Feud. The performance this relates to might have been staged in Osaka. The Shimazakirō was a brothel in Shinagawa where Seigorō got into a quarrel.
title: Actor Bandō Jūzaburō III as Mizuhiki Seigorō
